document.ModsDocTitle: The genus Coprinellus (Basidiomycota; Agaricales) in Pakistan with the description of four new species
document.docAuthor: Hussain, Shah, Usman, Muhammad, Afshan, Najam-ul-Sehar, Ahmad, Habib, Khan, Junaid & Khalid, Abdul Nasir
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Coprinellus (Basidiomycota; Agaricales) in Pakistan with the description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Coprinellus (Basidiomycota; Agaricales) in Pakistan with the description of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Coprinellus tenuis Hussain sp. nov. Figures 1 C-Dand 7

The new species Coprinellus tenuis can be recognised by its thin and membranous pileus, surface glabrous and furred, deeply plicate towards margin; lamellae sinuate to uncinate; basidiospores 10.5-14.5 x 8.0-9.5 x 6.5-8.5 µm , in face view, broadly ellipsoid to ovoid, in side view, slightly pyriform to ellipsoid, usually with truncate base, apiculus mostly not visible, with eccentric germ-pore, 1.5-2 µm wide.
PAKISTAN: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Malakand, Qaldara, 430 m alt., solitary on leaf litter, 7 July 2014, S. Hussain, SHP10 (SWAT-SH-P10, holotype); GenBank accession ITS: MH753663.
"tenuis" (Latin) meaning thin, referring to the membranous pileus of the new species.

Pileus 15-20 mm diam, pulvinate to convex to plane, light greyish-brown (7.5YR 5/2) to light brown (5YR 6/4); surface glabrous, furred, deeply plicate from centre towards margin; centre truncately conical, moderate reddish-orange (10R 5/8) to greyish-reddish-orange (2.5YR 5/6); context membranous. Lamellae sinuate to uncinate, distant, with 0-2 series of lamelullae, light greyish-brown (7.5YR 5/2) to light brown (5YR 6/4), lamellae edge blackish and fimbriate to eroded. Stipe 40-60 x 1 mm, equal, cylindrical, surface scabrous, white, translucent, fragile, context hollow.

Basidiospores (9.0 -)10.5-14.5(- 15.5) x (7.5 -)8.0-9.5(- 10.5) x (5.0 -)6.5-8.5(- 9.0) µm , on average 13.1 x 9.0 x 7.8 µm ; Q1 = 1.25-1.49, Q2 = 1.57-1.63, av. Q = 1.45; in face view, broadly ellipsoid to ovoid, in side view, slightly pyriform to ellipsoid, usually with truncate base, apiculus mostly not visible, germ-pore eccentric, 1.5-2 µm wide, wall 1.5 µm thick, dark brown to almost black. Basidia 22-24 x 9-12 µm , clavate, 2- to 4-spored, hyaline in KOH. Cheilocystidia 22-30 x 19-28 µm , rounded to globose, abundant, hyaline. Pleurocystidia absent. Pileocystidia 78-94 x 10-12 µm , lageniform to cylindrical with rounded apex, elongated rod shape neck with rounded enlarged base, hyaline in KOH. Caulocystidia 50-67 x 9-11 µm , narrowly clavate to clavate, with rounded to obtuse apex, cylindrical base. Veil comprised of rounded to subglobose cells, arranged in short chain, thick-walled with encrusted walls, dark brown, with terminal cell 17-23 x 12-15 µm .
Scattered on leaf litter under Acacia modesta , so far only known from lowland northern Pakistan.
PAKISTAN. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: Malakand, Qaldara, on leaf litter under Acacia modesta , 10 July 2014, S. Hussain, SH10 (SWAT SH-10).
